attributes.action: Use centre assessed grades with optional examinations for A level 2021.
attributes.additional_details: 2020 has been an unfair year to everyone. Students all over the country have missed months of in-school learning. Some more than others (specifically those in the north of England). Some students won't have had internet access at home, some without a computer. Some will have lost family members this year. Many will have had a severe mental health decline due to the isolation caused by COVID-19. It is entirely unfair to force students to sit exams as if nothing has happened this year.
attributes.background: The A level examinations to be sat in 2021 should be optional for people who feel they haven't met their academic potential enough to be graded a centre assessed grade. Otherwise, centre assessed grades should be the main system for awarding grades this academic year in order for it to be fair.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/559964
